publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3485# Mr Keith Harding: Breast Cancer Awarenessâ€”That the Parliament congratulates all the voluntary and research agencies involved for their efforts in highlighting Breast Cancer Awareness Month; recognises the importance of continuing research into the diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer, building upon major advances achieved over past decades; records its thanks to all the medical and ancillary staff involved for their unstinting kindness and support to patients and their families, and considers that the Scottish Executive should ensure that funding is made available for increasing awareness, research, providing treatment and support and all other aspects of breast cancer care.Supported by: Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Tommy Sheridan*, Margaret Smith*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, David Mundell*, Brian Adam*, Andrew Wilson*, Mr Murray Tosh*, Michael Matheson*, Bill Butler*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Mr Michael McMahon*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Christine Grahame*, Fergus Ewing*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Dr Sylvia Jackson*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Scott Barrie*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Mary Scanlon*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Alex Johnstone*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-3485# Breast Cancer Awareness (lodged on 10 October 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*

*S1M-3485# Mr Keith Harding: Breast Cancer Awareness-That the Parliament congratulates all the voluntary and research agencies involved for their efforts in highlighting Breast Cancer Awareness Month; recognises the importance of continuing research into the diagnosis and treatment of breast cancer, building upon major advances achieved over past decades; records its thanks to all the medical and ancillary staff involved for their unstinting kindness and support to patients and their families, and considers that the Scottish Executive should ensure that funding is made available for increasing awareness, research, providing treatment and support and all other aspects of breast cancer care.
